intro: Siparuna decipiens, commonly known as the False Siparuna, is a species of flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical in shape. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, arranged in clusters, and are accompanied by small, round, red berries that are an important food source for various bird species. Siparuna decipiens is often found in moist, shaded areas of tropical forests, where it thrives in the understory vegetation.
